What?? no review?? Oh well here goes. For a first run picking the fighter, i must say that i'm pretty impressed!! The story (which you don't have to pay attention to really (sorry devs, not hating :) )  i find it rather cool for now. I for a long time have been waiting for some type of beatemup/rpg skill building that is actually worth it and with the team up skills and all, wow keep it up please! Do put online co-op please please please pretty please!!!!!

If you have a controller and want to play a type of river city ransom meets rpg kind of game and have 10$ to spare, do yourself a favor or send it as a gift to someone you know who would love it :)


Happy Holidays y'all

Cheers!

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nWishmere is an excellent game and I highly recommend this game to those that love old school" beat em ups
date: or wanting to get into the genre.\n\nThe gameplay is great
recommended: it really does have that old-school beat em up feel to it.  The attacks are quite fluid and fast too.  Although there are some differences that separate this game from the rest.  You can perform combos to do high amounts of damage.  There is an active block that you can utilize to negate damage.\n\nAs for characters
hoursPlayed: each one has their own unique set of special moves and secret arts.  Special moves can be used on their own or can be used in a combo
voteText: kinda like a finisher.  Secret arts are like your ultimate moves
helpfulPercent: some can wipe out enemies on the screen
votesHelpful: while others may grant you additional attack powers.  There are also team attacks that you can perform with another player that can potentially wipe the screen of enemies.\n\nThere are currently two modes that you can play
votesTotal: arcade and story mode.  Arcade mode has 3 difficulties:  easy
commentsCount: and hard.  These 3 difficulties are basically like horde mode except it is not infinite
column16: after you beat 5 rounds the level ends
column17: but you can always replay.  Then you have your endless mode
column18: the rounds are infinite and you play until you run out of health.\n\nAs for story mode you get to learn more about the characters and the lore of the game.  There isnt much currently
column19: but will definitely be expand upon as the game gets updated.\n\nThere is only local coop as of now.  Online coop is TBD.  From a singleplayer standpoint the game is still very enjoyable
column20: not one moment did I ever get bored from playing by myself.  That is not to say I dont want Online MP
column21: I would love to see it implemented.\n\nAs for hours to price ratio
column22: you will definitely get your moneys worth from this game and more.\n\nOverall Wishmere is an excellent game to play and add it to your already awesome collection of games.  I hope this review helps you in deciding whether to purchase the game or not."
